tafsirQuiz.question: According to the tafsir, what should we understand from this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: ‘By the pen, and all that they write’ refers to historical record. In historical records of human memoirs accumulated and preserved in the shape of history, the Quran is an exceptional book and the bearer of that book an exceptional personality
distractors: This verse addresses only legal rulings
This verse focuses on scientific facts
This verse is primarily about historical events

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Qalam, Ayah 2?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Having a sublime character means rising above the standard of others’ behaviour. It should not be the believer’s way to deal badly with those who are not good to him, while giving fair treatment to those who are good to him
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: ‘Do not give in to the deniers of truth’ means that the words of those who deny the truth are not worthy of acceptance. On the one hand, there is the upholder of Truth, who has taken his stand by virtue of reasoning
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In some cases, it manifests itself in this world, but in the Hereafter it will manifest itself for all, and none shall be exempt from it. Whatever a man earns in this world is apparently from farming or industry or other such pursuits
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse primarily teach us?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Such entirely different characters cannot have an identical fate. A man who is not God-fearing gives importance only to visible material things, whereas the God-fearing person is one who is serious about the unseen reality
distractors: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only
This verse describes the creation of mankind

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: On the Day of Judgement when God will reveal Himself, the true believers will fall prostrate before their Lord, just as they bowed down before Him in their previous life
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In short, he may do anything of a discourageing nature, but the missionary must at all times abstain from negative reaction. His success is dependent upon two things—tolerance of excesses on the part of the addressee and having no expectation of material gain from him
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
